update.description:
This pull request includes a variety of fixes for Windows, including a native implementation of IP address determination.  With these changes in place, I'm able to build and run a unit test from `haptix_comm`.

I already merged from the `multicast` branch and resolved conflicts, so this PR should land after that one has landed.  Alternatively, this PR could be targeted at the `multicast` branch.
update.title: (Merge #25 first) Various Windows fixes

update.description:
This pull request includes a variety of fixes for Windows, including a native implementation of IP address determination.  With these changes in place, I'm able to build and run a unit test from `haptix_comm`.

I already merged from the `multicast` branch and resolved conflicts, so this PR should land after that one has landed.  Alternatively, this PR could be targeted at the `multicast` branch.
update.title: (Merge #25 first) Various Windows fixes

content.raw: That's what I was thinking: we test it and look for problems.  I played with adding delays, but as far as I can tell, that won't do it.  I think that, to work around the Windows bug, we need to change how `NodeShared::GetInstance()` works, to dynamically allocate the instance, and to allow a way to explicitly free it before the global process teardown starts.  I started doing that but decided that it was not worth it unless we first see a problem.
content.html: That's what I was thinking: we test it and look for problems. I played with adding delays, but as far as I can tell, that won't do it. I think that, to work around the Windows bug, we need to change how NodeShared::GetInstance() works, to dynamically allocate the instance, and to allow a way to explicitly free it before the global process teardown starts. I started doing that but decided that it was not worth it unless we first see a problem.

content.raw: I made a few minor style changes in cac96a4. Feel free to merge them.
content.html: I made a few minor style changes in cac96a4. Feel free to merge them.

content.raw: Not sure what will happen if zeromq is still working under the hood (in the threadReception thread) and we terminate the main thread here. I'm fine with it if we don't see problems during testing. If we see problems we could at least try to wait some milliseconds before leaving the destructor.
content.html: Not sure what will happen if zeromq is still working under the hood (in the threadReception thread) and we terminate the main thread here. I'm fine with it if we don't see problems during testing. If we see problems we could at least try to wait some milliseconds before leaving the destructor.

This pull request includes a variety of fixes for Windows, including a native implementation of IP address determination.  With these changes in place, I'm able to build and run a unit test from `haptix_comm`.

I already merged from the `multicast` branch and resolved conflicts, so this PR should land after that one has landed.  Alternatively, this PR could be targeted at the `multicast` branch.
update.title: (Merge #25 first) Various Windows fixes

content.raw: Replace this casting by a C++ reinterpret_cast?
content.html: Replace this casting by a C++ reinterpret_cast?

content.raw: I would change this casting by a reinterpret_cast<RPC_CSTR*>(&szUuid)
content.html: I would change this casting by a reinterpret_cast<RPC_CSTR*>(&szUuid)

content.raw: fe78ca2 switched to Release, per @_jrivero_ 's suggestion.
content.html: fe78ca2 switched to Release, per @jrivero 's suggestion.

content.raw: Good idea.  Switched to Release in fe78ca2.  Also switch `haptix_comm/windows_fixes` to match.  We should probably start building both Debug and Release in all our packages, because Windows requires that we choose one or the other all the way through the stack.
content.html: Good idea. Switched to Release in fe78ca2. Also switch haptix_comm/windows_fixes to match. We should probably start building both Debug and Release in all our packages, because Windows requires that we choose one or the other all the way through the stack.
